alert.note: Alert for Klamath (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 30 at 1:47PM PDT until May 01 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oregon... Sprague River near Beatty affecting Klamath County. For the Sprague River...including Beatty...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sprague River near Beatty. * WHEN...Until late Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Flooding of structures along the Sprague River in the vicinity of Sprague River, Lone Pine, and down stream can be expected. Widespread agricultural flooding is likely in this area as well. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:15 PM PDT Sunday the stage was 8.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:15 PM PDT Sunday was 8.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain above flood stage tonight into Monday morning then fall below flood stage late Monday morning and continue slowly falling to 7.5 feet by early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 8.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.6 feet on 03/10/1989. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 145 AM PDT.
